profile_positions.description:
▪ Lead research scientist, recent joint industry projects: 
1) Carboniferous, Zechstein and Jurassic plays in the Dutch offshore. GEODE Atlas Phase 1, an open digital resource atlas. Collaboration between TNO and EBN (2021-2022). https://www.geodeatlas.nl/
2) Understanding Z2 carbonate platforms, stratigraphy and paleogeography in the Dutch Northern Offshore (Zephyr Project, 2022). https://kennisbank.ebn.nl/en/zephyr-zechstein-play-project-2021/
3) Chalk structural and depositional evolution in the vicinity of salt tectonics structures in the Dutch offshore and onshore: Geophysical and Geological characterisation (CREST Project, 2019-2021). 
4) Stratigraphic, source rock and tectonostratigraphic characterisation of the Lower Carboniferous in the Central and Southern North Sea (PALEO-FIVE Project, 2020). 
5) Tectonostratigraphy and paleogeography of the Dutch Central Graben during the Late Jurassic (MAXIM Project, 2019).
6) Burial and structuration analysis of the Dinantian carbonates in the Dutch subsurface (SCAN Geothermal Project, 2019).https://www.nlog.nl/sites/default/files/2019-09/scan_dinantian_burial_and_structuration_report.pdf
7) Characterisation of Upper Jurassic-Lower Cretaceous Sandstones, Dutch Offshore (FOCUS and COMMA Projects, 2016). https://www.nlog.nl/sites/default/files/2019-01/FOCUS_TNO_report_2016%20reduced.pdf and https://www.nlog.nl/sites/default/files/2019-12/comma_report_full-v2016.11.30.pdf
8) Early salt movement in the Dutch Offshore (STEM Project, 2017).
9) Tectono-stratigraphy of the Upper Carboniferous-Lower Permian in the northern Dutch offshore (NORTHERN OFFSHORE Project, 2016). https://www.nlog.nl/sites/default/files/2018-11/NORTHERN_OFFSHORE_TNO_report_2015_R10920_0.pdf
▪ Field trip leader, Boulonnais (France), Annot Basin (French Alps), Ross Basin (Ireland), Midland Valley and Northumberland basins (NE England/SE Scotland).
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist - Exploration and Geology Teams Lead

profile_positions.description:
▪ Field trip organizer and leader for geoscientists and reservoir engineers (A/S Norske Shell). Understanding a high net-to-gross confined deep-water systems in SE France. Implication for the Ormen Lange Field, Norway. 
▪ Technical advisor, evaluation of new plays in the Piceance Basin, Colorado, EMARC industry consortium. 
▪ Editor/author of a special publication of the AAPG Bulletin, Petroleum systems of the northern deep Gulf of Mexico, P. Weimer and R. Bouroullec, eds., 9 papers.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

company.name: Colorado School of Mines, Colorado Energy Research Institute (CERI)

profile_positions.description:
▪ Geological analysis of subsurface data to evaluate potentials for CO2 Sequestration in the Denver Basin. PI: Prof. D. Nummedal
▪ Visiting Professor at the Energy and Mineral Applied Research Center, University of Colorado at Boulder. Structural Analysis of the Piceance Basin, western Colorado. Seismic interpretation to characterize the structural evolution of the basin from Cambrian to Cenozoic. PI: Prof. P. Weimer.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description:
▪ Outcrop characterization to decrease uncertainties in deep-water clastic reservoirs (Morillo depositional system, Spain; Annot Basin, France).
▪ Analysis of deepwater channel stacking and reservoir implications.
▪ Evaluation of the impact of syn-depositional movements on deep-water deposits (Annot Basin, 3D structural modelling of the Ainsa Basin). 
▪ MSc Advisor (5 students)
▪ Faculty sponsor of the American Association of Petroleum Geologist Student Chapter.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description:
▪ ExxonMobil, Houston:
Structural setting of the Mississippi Canyon and Atwater Valley protraction areas (3 days).
▪ ENI-Agip, Houston: 
Evaluation of regional seismic correlations of top and base allochthonous salt in Mississippi Canyon and Atwater Valley area.
2D structural restorations to evaluate a new of a prospect in the Deep GOM.
Advisory role on volumetric calculation for four prospects in the Deep GOM. Presentation of the results to the global ENI audit team evaluating prospects corporation-wide. 
Evaluation of salt movement history around a compressional structure (Deep GOM), resulting to new investment of $1.5 Million of 3D reprocessing.
▪ Petro-Canada, Calgary
Stratigraphy and sedimentology of the Oil Sands along the Steepbank River, Alberta. Technical advisor on acquisition of Lidar data. Development of a new workflow for modelling of meandering river systems.
profile_positions.title: Part-time Consultant

company.name: The University of Texas at Austin, Bureau of Economic Geology

profile_positions.company: The University of Texas at Austin
profile_positions.description:
▪ Principal Investigator of the LASR (Laser-Assisted Analogs of Siliciclastic Reservoirs) Industrial Associate research program 2006-2007. 
▪ Sedimentologist/Stratigrapher, LASR between 2003 and 2006. Deep-water outcrop characterization using conventional, Lidar and GPR data. Study of deep-water depositional systems (Brushy Canyon, West Texas; Grès d’Annot, SE France; Capistrano Fm., California; Ross Fm., Ireland) and shallow–water deposits (Ferron Sandstones, Utah). PI: D. Jennette.
▪ Lead Structural Geologist: Salt tectonics of southeastern Mexican basins in collaboration with PEMEX, 2003-2005.
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

company.name: University of Colorado Boulder, Energy and Mineral Applied Research Centre (EMARC)

profile_positions.description:
▪ Structural analysis of the northern deep Gulf of Mexico in the Mississippi Canyon, Atwater Valley, De Soto Canyon and Lloyd Ridge protraction areas. Co-PI of the Industrial consortium, “Petroleum systems of the Mississippi Canyon/Atwater Valley area, northern Gulf of Mexico”. 20 industrial sponsors.
▪ Salt tectonics analysis from Jurassic to Present. 
▪ 2D structural restoration.
▪ Petroleum system modelling.
profile_positions.title: Post-Doctoral Research Associate

profile_positions.description: ▪ Outcrop analysis, sedimentology and stratigraphy of a deep-water carbonate escarpment, Maiella, Italy. Mentor: Franz Van Buchem.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: ▪ Stratigraphic and structural analysis of a growth fault/raft system in the Congo Margin. Well log, seismic analysis and structural restoration. Mentors: Stéphane Raillard and Prof. Francois Guillocheau.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: ▪ Military service in the Sedimentology Department of the French Navy (EPSHOM, Etablissement Principal du Service Hydrographic et Oceanographic de la Marine). Analysis of tidal sand waves in the English Channel. Data collection for 1 month aboard an oceanographic vessel. Historical analysis of the evolution of the area between 1971 and 1995. Mentor: Dr. Thierry Garlan.
profile_positions.title: Sedimentologist

volunteer_experiences.role: AAPG Siliciclastic Reservoirs of the Middle East Workshop, Kuwait City.
Faculty Sponsor - Colorado School of Mines
